title: Strengthening Software Development Practical Skills: Computer Technology-Based Mathematics Instructional Design for Low-Achieving Students

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners design three problem-solving game-based math activities for low-achieving students (teens) over a 1–6-month course, achieving an average of 3+ points on a 4-point peer evaluation scale and ≥80% positive responses in learner satisfaction surveys.
Learners develop instructional plans utilizing customized tutoring systems applicable in smartphone environments
Learners design summative evaluation tools to assess the effectiveness of computer technology-based learning tools

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
